name: facilely
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you say or do something facilely, what you say or do is too simple and has not been thought about enough: "Were you disappointed by the result?" asked the interviewer facilely. They jumped facilely to the conclusion that we were to blame.
More examplesFewer examplesSome critics facilely describe him as a painter of erotica, but there is so much more to his work.The commentator had facilely assimilated all the different ethnic groups under a single name.You can't just facilely extend those limited findings to the whole community.
